trans-unit.source: Connect to SQL Database by using Ruby with TinyTDS on Windows
trans-unit.target: Connect to SQL Database by using Ruby with TinyTDS on Windows

trans-unit.source: Give a Ruby code sample you can run on Windows to connect to Azure SQL Database.
trans-unit.target: Give a Ruby code sample you can run on Windows to connect to Azure SQL Database.

trans-unit.source: Connect to SQL Database by using Ruby on Windows
trans-unit.target: Connect to SQL Database by using Ruby on Windows

trans-unit.source: This topic presents a Ruby code sample that runs on a Windows computer running Windows 8.1 to connect to an Azure SQL Database database.
trans-unit.target: This topic presents a Ruby code sample that runs on a Windows computer running Windows 8.1 to connect to an Azure SQL Database database.

trans-unit.source: Install the required modules
trans-unit.target: Install the required modules

trans-unit.source: Open your terminal and install the following:
trans-unit.target: Open your terminal and install the following:

trans-unit.source: **1) Ruby:** If your machine does not have Ruby please install it.
trans-unit.target: **1) Ruby:** If your machine does not have Ruby please install it.

trans-unit.source: For new ruby users, we recommend you use Ruby 2.1.X installers.
trans-unit.target: For new ruby users, we recommend you use Ruby 2.1.X installers.

trans-unit.source: These provide a stable language and a extensive list of packages (gems) that are compatible and updated.
trans-unit.target: These provide a stable language and a extensive list of packages (gems) that are compatible and updated.

trans-unit.source: [Go the Ruby download page](http://rubyinstaller.org/downloads/) and download the appropriate 2.1.x installer.
trans-unit.target: [Go the Ruby download page](http://rubyinstaller.org/downloads/) and download the appropriate 2.1.x installer.

trans-unit.source: For example if you are on a 64 bit machine, download the **Ruby 2.1.6 (x64)** installer.
trans-unit.target: For example if you are on a 64 bit machine, download the **Ruby 2.1.6 (x64)** installer.

trans-unit.source: Once the installer is downloaded, do the following:
trans-unit.target: Once the installer is downloaded, do the following:

trans-unit.source: Double-click the file to start the installer.
trans-unit.target: Double-click the file to start the installer.

trans-unit.source: Select your language, and agree to the terms.
trans-unit.target: Select your language, and agree to the terms.

trans-unit.source: On the install settings screen, select the check boxes next to both *Add Ruby executables to your PATH* and *Associate .rb and .rbw files with this Ruby installation*.
trans-unit.target: On the install settings screen, select the check boxes next to both *Add Ruby executables to your PATH* and *Associate .rb and .rbw files with this Ruby installation*.

trans-unit.source: **2) DevKit:** Download DevKit from the [RubyInstaller page](http://rubyinstaller.org/downloads/)
trans-unit.target: **2) DevKit:** Download DevKit from the [RubyInstaller page](http://rubyinstaller.org/downloads/)

trans-unit.source: After the download is finished, do the following:
trans-unit.target: After the download is finished, do the following:

trans-unit.source: Double-click the file.
trans-unit.target: Double-click the file.

trans-unit.source: You will be asked where to extract the files.
trans-unit.target: You will be asked where to extract the files.

trans-unit.source: Click the "..."
trans-unit.target: Click the "..."

trans-unit.source: button, and select "C:\DevKit".
trans-unit.target: button, and select "C:\DevKit".

trans-unit.source: You will probably need to create this folder first by clicking "Make New Folder".
trans-unit.target: You will probably need to create this folder first by clicking "Make New Folder".

trans-unit.source: Click "OK", and then "Extract", to extract the files.
trans-unit.target: Click "OK", and then "Extract", to extract the files.

trans-unit.source: Now open the Command Prompt and enter the following commands:
trans-unit.target: Now open the Command Prompt and enter the following commands:

trans-unit.source: You now have a fully functional Ruby and RubyGems!
trans-unit.target: You now have a fully functional Ruby and RubyGems!

trans-unit.source: **3) TinyTDS:** Navigate to C:\DevKit and run the following command from your terminal.
trans-unit.target: **3) TinyTDS:** Navigate to C:\DevKit and run the following command from your terminal.

trans-unit.source: This will install TinyTDS on your machine.
trans-unit.target: This will install TinyTDS on your machine.

trans-unit.source: Create a database, retrieve your connection string
trans-unit.target: Create a database, retrieve your connection string

trans-unit.source: The Ruby sample relies on the `AdventureWorks` sample database.
trans-unit.target: The Ruby sample relies on the `AdventureWorks` sample database.

trans-unit.source: If you do not already have `AdventureWorks`, you can see how to create it by visiting [Create your first Azure SQL Database](sql-database-get-started.md).
trans-unit.target: If you do not already have `AdventureWorks`, you can see how to create it by visiting [Create your first Azure SQL Database](sql-database-get-started.md).

trans-unit.source: The topic also explains how to retrieve the database connection string.
trans-unit.target: The topic also explains how to retrieve the database connection string.

trans-unit.source: Connect to your SQL Database
trans-unit.target: Connect to your SQL Database

trans-unit.source: The [TinyTDS::Client](https://github.com/rails-sqlserver/tiny_tds) function is used to connect to SQL Database.
trans-unit.target: The [TinyTDS::Client](https://github.com/rails-sqlserver/tiny_tds) function is used to connect to SQL Database.

trans-unit.source: Execute a SELECT statement and retrieve the result set
trans-unit.target: Execute a SELECT statement and retrieve the result set

trans-unit.source: Copy and paste the following code in an empty file.
trans-unit.target: Copy and paste the following code in an empty file.

trans-unit.source: Call it test.rb.
trans-unit.target: Call it test.rb.

trans-unit.source: Then execute it by entering the following command from your command prompt:
trans-unit.target: Then execute it by entering the following command from your command prompt:

trans-unit.source: In the code sample, the [TinyTds::Result](https://github.com/rails-sqlserver/tiny_tds) function is used to retrieve a result set from a query against SQL Database.
trans-unit.target: In the code sample, the [TinyTds::Result](https://github.com/rails-sqlserver/tiny_tds) function is used to retrieve a result set from a query against SQL Database.

trans-unit.source: This function accepts a query and returns a result set.
trans-unit.target: This function accepts a query and returns a result set.

trans-unit.source: The results set is iterated over by using [result.each do |row|](https://github.com/rails-sqlserver/tiny_tds).
trans-unit.target: The results set is iterated over by using [result.each do |row|](https://github.com/rails-sqlserver/tiny_tds).

trans-unit.source: Inserting a row, passing parameters, and retrieving the generated primary key value
trans-unit.target: Inserting a row, passing parameters, and retrieving the generated primary key value

trans-unit.source: The code sample:
trans-unit.target: The code sample:

trans-unit.source: Passes parameters for values to be inserted in a row.
trans-unit.target: Passes parameters for values to be inserted in a row.

trans-unit.source: Inserts the row.
trans-unit.target: Inserts the row.

trans-unit.source: Retrieves the value that was generated for the primary key.
trans-unit.target: Retrieves the value that was generated for the primary key.

trans-unit.source: In SQL Database, the [IDENTITY](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/ms186775.aspx) property and the [SEQUENCE](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/ff878058.aspx) object can be used to auto-generate [primary key values](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/ms179610.aspx).
trans-unit.target: In SQL Database, the [IDENTITY](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/ms186775.aspx) property and the [SEQUENCE](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/ff878058.aspx) object can be used to auto-generate [primary key values](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/ms179610.aspx).

trans-unit.source: To use TinyTDS with Azure, it is recommended that you execute several `SET` statements to change how the current session handles specific information.
trans-unit.target: To use TinyTDS with Azure, it is recommended that you execute several `SET` statements to change how the current session handles specific information.

trans-unit.source: Recommended `SET` statements are provided in the code sample.
trans-unit.target: Recommended `SET` statements are provided in the code sample.

trans-unit.source: For example, `SET ANSI_NULL_DFLT_ON` will allow new columns created to allow null values even if the nullability status of the column is not explicitly stated.
trans-unit.target: For example, `SET ANSI_NULL_DFLT_ON` will allow new columns created to allow null values even if the nullability status of the column is not explicitly stated.

trans-unit.source: To align with the Microsoft SQL Server [datetime](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/ms187819.aspx) format, use the [strftime](http://ruby-doc.org/core-2.2.0/Time.html#method-i-strftime) function to cast to the corresponding datetime format.
trans-unit.target: To align with the Microsoft SQL Server [datetime](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/ms187819.aspx) format, use the [strftime](http://ruby-doc.org/core-2.2.0/Time.html#method-i-strftime) function to cast to the corresponding datetime format.
